title: [K-12] Collaborative Learning Design in Social Studies Through MOOC Peer Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social studies comprehension and smartphone utilization skills
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning program conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, aiming to progressively enhance learning effectiveness through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can accurately evaluate the qualitative level of social topic summaries at 80% or higher using peer assessment rubrics.
Learners can revise and improve their social topic summaries at least twice by reflecting on peer feedback.
Learners can write evaluation reports utilizing three or more constructive feedback techniques during the peer assessment process.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
